A zero buffer has no effect: A zero buffer has no effect
available map map layers (at least 1 req: available map map layers (at least 1 required)
Calculate a 'buffer' around the visible: Calculate a 'buffer' around the visible elements in map layer 1
Calculate the shortest distance from all: Calculate the shortest distance from all elements in layer 1 to the nearest element in layer 2.
Choose another view angle above<br><i>or:
Choose another view angle above
or use CTRL + mouse button
or drag the compass needle at the bottom left of the map
or use 2 fingers on a touch screen
Click a map element for info on that ele: Click on an object to view its properties such as name, height or population.
Click on a result to zoom: Click on a result to zoom
Click on the image for a full streetview: Click on the image for a full streetview
Click on the map to measure distance or: Click on the map to measure distance or area
Click the StreetView button to show a st: Click the StreetView button to show a streetview image
draw-help-edit-element:
click on point to move
click on the small point between 2 points to add a point
click on a {{otherelement}} to select {{referelement}}
click on 'point', 'line' or 'shape' to draw a new element
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-edit-point:
click on trash can to remove point
move the selected point to a new location
click on the small point between 2 points to add a point
click on 'point', 'line' or 'shape' to draw a new element
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-line:
click on the map to add a line
click again on the endpoint or [ENTER] to complete the line
hold [ALT] to disable the snap function
click on 'select' to edit an existing line
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-point:
click on the map to add a point
hold [ALT] to disable the snap function
click on 'select' to edit an existing point
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-polygon:
click on the map to add an shape
hold [ALT] to disable the snap function
click again on the last added point or [ENTER] to complete the shape
click on 'select' to edit an existing shape
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-select-element:
click on {{indefinitearticleelement}} to select
click on 'point', 'line' or 'shape' to draw a new element
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-selected-non-point:
click on trash can to remove
click again on {{definitearticleelement}} to edit shape
click on a {{otherelement}} to select {{referelement}}
click on 'point', 'line' or 'shape' to draw a new element
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
draw-help-selected-point:
click on trash can to remove
move the selected point to a new location
click on another point to select it
click on 'point', 'line' or 'shape' to draw a new element
click on ⋮ for a new map layer or layer properties
Enter at least 1 complete word above. For example, 'Saudi' for 'Saudi Arabia'.
Hopscotch coordinates explain:
Here you can:
  • view the coordinates of the pointer.
  • click on the map to lock the coordinates.
  • click on the coordinate to copy.
Hopscotch legend explain: Here, the legends for the map layers will be shown. The legend for the background layer is also available
Hopscotch map explain:
You can:
  • zoom in and out, from world wide down to your house
  • drag the map to almost any location on earth.
Hopscotch scale and attribution explain:
Here you can:
  • read the scale of the map.
  • read the attribution.
Hopscotch tools explain:
With these buttons, you perform operations on the map.

Hover the mouse over the buttons for additional information
Hopscotch zoom explain:
Here you can:
  • zoom in and out using the '+' and '-' buttons.
  • adjust and reset the north orientation.
  • enter a zoom level directly.
Please enter a valid service URL.
map projections not supported by this vi: map projections not supported by this viewer
name: name
no info available for this location: no info available for this location
Note: most objects on the background map: Note: most objects on the background maps do not have additional information.
Select point, line, or shape layer: Select point, line, or shape layer
Select to add to the map: Select to add to the map
The search function prioritizes location: The search function prioritizes locations that are within the map view. If (almost) nothing is found there, the search will expand to other areas.
